Description: 13 beads of different shapes and materials. A: Barrel-shaped glass bead, broken at one end, made of dark blue glass with a a white glass filament running around the body in a spiral shape. B: Two small roughly spherical beads made of glass, one of them dark blue the other with a white corrosion layer. C: Large disc-bead with a small perforation and a sharp edge, made of some sort of faience in a vivid turquoise colour. D: Very small bead in a flat disc-shape, with small protruding parts creating a flower pattern. Made of turquoise faience. E: One flattened spherical bead made of greenish glass. F: One cylindrical bead made of red faience. One shallow groove running along the body. G: Two small disc-shaped beads made of turquoise faience, one of them slightly smaller. H: Four cylindrical segmented beads made of turquoise faience.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
